name: Dessole Pyramisa Sharm El Sheikh Resort

reviews.title: Mixed Views - Depends what you're looking for!
reviews.text: We booked a stay at the Pyramisa as a last minutetrip and having never been to Sharm before. The view we had of the hotel was based on expectations and how much it cost.

It was a fairly large hotel and we were given a room on the front overlooking the beach and sea. This was ideal for us though was a ten minute walk uphill and alot of staps to reception so wouldn't ideal for most. The room itself was massive with a nice balcony and didn't have any complaints about it.
reviews.title: dont go please

reviews.text: The beach area was on top of the cliffs which was fine with access to the see over a pontoon. The loungers were plentiful and the bar was fine. After the first few days my drinks had already been poured by the tme I got to the beach bar which was excellent.
reviews.title: this must be the worst hotel in sharm its put me off egypt forever rooms were di

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were a few restaurants which served pretty much the same dishes but in different settings. Breakfast was good with plenty of variety hot, cold, fruit, pastries etc. Dinner ws in themes and was fine. My only complaint was the cleanliness of the pizza/chicken snack bar which was awful so we only ate the once. To see the little birds rolling around in the pizza flour is enough to put anyone off!
reviews.title: Love the sea, hate the hotel

reviews.text: Naama bay isn't everyones cup of tea, as its quite intimidating sometimes, but we liked it and made a few trips in the hotel bus.
reviews.title: Please read! Its not awful!!

likes.liked: — The staff and the pool area

reviews.text: Was really worried about going on holiday due to all the bad reviews. It was better than I expected. We arrived at 4 in the morning, only to find that our travel agaent hadn,t booked enough rooms. There was no hassle at reception they just gave us the extra rooms and told us to see our rep first thing in the morning. We saw our rep next morning and within in 10 minutes we were upgraded to a 3-bed beachfront villa. It needn't a bit of TLC, but it was perfect for our party of 7. The hotel is being gradually refurbished, once it is finished it will definately be worth another visit. This didn't affect our stay in any way though. There are a lot of steps at the hotel, but there is a bus that runs every 1/2 hour to take you from the beaches to reception. However, we rarely used the bus and if you take it easy it really isn't too much of a problem.
reviews.title: Not as bad as I thought it was going to be.

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, helpfullness of staff and location

reviews.text: There are 3 beaches at the property. Beach 1 is very noisy and ideally suited for youngsters with continual loud music. Beaches 2 and 3 are much better. We used beach 3. There is a nice beach bar there and Amar will bring drinksd to you once you get to know him. To get to the sea you have to go along a jetty (which is not falling apart as I have previously read) this is to protect the coral. It is a good idea to take beach shoes as the jettys get quite slippy. Once in the sea the snorkelling is fantastic. I have never seen so many exotic fish, absoutely brilliant. We went on a boat trip to Raz Mohammad, but to be quite honest the snorkelling is better at the hotel beaches.
reviews.title: Not Good

reviews.text: The food is not brilliant and yes a few of my party got ill, but I can go to spain and get an upset stomache so this is nothing new for me. If you go to the chemist at the hotel pay no more than £5 for the pills that you need and don't be afraid to haggle the price with him. Within 24 hours you will feel better. You can also haggle in the hotel shops. I can recommend eating in the Bora Bora restaurant for breakfast as the staff there are really nice. The pizza restaurant is also very good.
reviews.title: A Turkish Prison must be more fun.

reviews.text: Night time entertainment is not that good, but we sat in the upstairs lounge most evenings where there was either a singer, paino player or a guitarist. Our favourite waiter in the bar is Sabry and a small tip gets you brilliant service. Our children watched the shows which they seemed to enjoy. Day time entertainment is centred around the massive pool. Water aeobics, water polo etc. The wave pool is on for 1/2 hour every hour, which was fine. The water slide was not working, but I am not sure why. As for there being no lifeguards, I really think if your kids are in the pool then you should watch them (lifeguards or not). It is quite noisy round the pool and you do have to get up early to get a sunbed (7am). There is no problem getting a bed on any of the beaches and there are plenty of sun shades.
reviews.title: Awful

reviews.text: There are lots of guys selling boat trips etc on the beach and round the pool, but they really do not hassle you if you tell them you are not interested. As previously mentioned we went on one boat trip which was good, but snorkelling not so good because all the boats arrive at the same time and I think this must frighten the fish off. Also do not touch the coral, because my husband and I got nasty stings from it. We saw manta rays, moray eels, tuna and loads more.
reviews.title: If you have booked - cancel and go somewhere else!

reviews.text: We returned to Sharm for the second time, having previously stayed at the Hilton in Sharks Bay. Love Egypt, love Sharm, would definitely go back but never ever ever to the Pyramisa! The reviews we read before leaving were quite favourable so nothing quite prepared us for what was going to happen during our stay.
reviews.title: awful

reviews.text: Arrival : Kept waiting for ages, late at night, not even offered a glass of water (5 star????). Eventually taken to room, ordered some room service (stale).
reviews.title: ** not a five star maybe a 3 **

reviews.text: Pool / Bars / Restaurants: The pool is filthy with residue round the pool bar area all the time. The staff are often aggressive and rude. The restaurants, well! spotted baby cockroaches running across tables, food always the same, every single person we met on holiday had some form of v and d within 5 days of arriving. WARNING: the chemist on the hotel grounds charges 25GBP for 3 boxes of medication for this (which will sort you out, immodium does NOT work), the REAL price is in arabic on the side and they are worth 3GBP. if u get the chance, when u r in naama bay just grab some of these meds (antinal, some green pills and antibiotics) at Dr Fayez on the main street. the chemist at the hotel will try to tell you that they cost the same in the whole of sharm but this is a lie and he is sitting on a little goldmine taking advantage of sick people. The staff fan barbequed meat with bird feathers, saw them drop the bird feather fan several times on the floor, pick it up and continue fanning the meat, even touching it with the feathers! There are 3 a la carte restaurants (chinese, indian, seafood). You need to pay for these. The chinese is ok, don't go to the seafood one (the fish is frozen and flown in from alexandria), the Indian is superb and spotted hotel management eating there most nights which says a lot about the state of the all-inclusive doesn't it!
reviews.title: Disgraceful ..Stay away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: Basic and acceptable. Mini bar never cold. Acclimatised to the air con after a few days and actually preferred it not being freezing. Beautiful views over sea but the 120 steps in 50 degree heat will tire you!
reviews.title: What a let down

reviews.text: Now for the biggie! Huge cockroach infestation in our room. We spoke to our rep, the front desk etc etc every day. Mohamed, the food and beverage manager at the hotel, very helpful and liaised with the Head of Housekeeping to fumigate our room. This however did not solve the problem, as huge and baby cockroaches continued to swarm our room. We put them in a wine cooler and took them to reception whereby after a 40 minute wait we were seen by the GM (Adil Shimi) as well as some of his other directors. They eventually settled to give us an upgrade as well as a la carte dining for the remainder of our stay (5 days). Once we started eating in the Indian (where the managers of the hotel also ate) we were no longer ill.
reviews.title: A great time had by all

reviews.text: Before going, I read some reviews and I was a bit worried of what to expect, however, considering the price payed it wasn't bad at all.
reviews.title: better than i thought after reading reviews

reviews.text: The food was ok, but after trying the chinease and seafood restaurant which you have to pay for, (drinks all inclusive) they where much better. The pizzeria which was also all inclusive was great.
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed stay - take no notice of poor reviews

reviews.text: The staff are really friendly, in the bar we always got another drink before we had finished our other one, the service was really good.
reviews.title: what a nightmare

likes.disliked: — the aircon in room 1144 ( horrible smell I'm sure something died in there!)

reviews.text: Neither me or my boyfriend had any problems with our tummy, i did however get a lot of bites, but went to the chemist and got cream and tablets which helped a lot.
reviews.title: Great Time
Not at all a 5 star
reviews.text: If you don't wake up early for the pool, you wont get a sunbed, however, on all 3 beaches whatever time we went we where always able to find one very easily. And yes there is a lot of steps but i didnt find them that bad, if you take it slow you dont feel horrible / tired.

aka: Pyramisa Sharm El-Sheikh Resort And Villas
description: A 5 star All Inclusive resort ideally located on the sandy beach of Sharks Bay. Resort facilities include 720 rooms, chalets and villas with exotic sea and pool views, the largest swimming-pool in Sharm with artificial waves, indoor swimming-pool, 4 restaurants, bars, disco, kids club and health club.
